data.title: Good, fast service
data.text:
We have eaten here for years. It is fairly good Mexican food located across from the local movie theater. Chips and salsa are fair. Salsa needs more spice and flavor. There isn't a lot of spice in the food so those who prefer milder food will like this restaurant.  My favorite is the gravy they use on their enchiladas. Some of my other favs are nachos. Meat, cheese, and gravy over chips are really yummy.

We have always had quick service which is nice if you plan to hit a movie afterwards.

data.title: The Gravy Over the Burrito
data.text: The service to get the order was slow but once the waitress arrived things picked up. The restaurant uses gravy. I ordered a burrito and the waitress asked if I wanted the gravy over my burrito. In my experience burritos don't have a sauce over it but since I like gooey items I gave it a try. It was delicious. I'm glad I tried the gravy over the burrito. During the meal the waitress left us to our meal. She wasn't one to keep coming over to ask if everything was OK which I like. I could see how the service could be seen as good or meh. I was comfortable with the restaurant's service. We sat outside that had shade overhead.

data.title: Think twice before going here
data.text: We have eaten in and had take out food from this place for over 8 years.  We will not go back.....the place has definitely deteriorated.  It needs a really good, thorough cleaning.  The carpets are filthy.  The service is really mediocre, seemed not to care if we were there or not.  Long wait to have order taken, and even slower to be served.  The food was only lukewarm and really tasteless.  It will take something really great to convince us to go back.

data.title: Good Rustic Mex
data.text: We stopped into Angelos for lunch.  The service was quick and the people friendly.  It's not a super trendy place -- sort of basic interior.  The food was very nice, but nothing really stood out as exceptional.  This is very standard Mexican fare and perfect for anyone who wants a nice plate of Enchiladas with beans and rice.  You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Mexican
data.text: Great food. Had combination  plater : tamale,steak ranchero, chile colorado . Service good but gave us our bill when our meals were served. Had salsa and chips but the Sala bowl was small and not enough for our basket,of chips. Had to, ask for more and was charged 75 cents.  First,time we have been charged when  extra salsa with our  meals.  Next time will make sure the salsa bowel  is filled not half. 2nd basket is $1.75. You are allowed  1,basket of chips per couple and 1 salsa. Just raise prices a $1 and give chips and salsa. If you are single you get the same amount. Tacky sign

data.title: Great Mexican Foo!
data.text: We love coming to Angelo's - good old fashion Mexican food. The service is pretty good, food is great & the prices are pretty reasonable. Good for family, friends or couples.

data.title: Good Mexican Food by the theater
data.text: I love their sauce (gravy) they put on enchiladas.  I love their chicken enchiladas.  Food comes quickly which is perfect if you want to go to the movies across the street after dinner.

data.title: Very Misleading Menu
data.text: Chose Flautas, ala carte, clearly listed on menu at one price, but was charged a higher price.  When questioned was told by Wait that others before me had complained but owner refuses to change display.  Flautas were mediocre, salsa lousy.

data.title: Return visit for delicious Mexican food.
data.text: Food is delicious, prices are very reasonable, service is friendly and prompt. We're out of town visitors, but always enjoy dining at Angelo's.

data.title: Our Lodi Favorite for Mexican
data.text: We don't live in Lodi any longer, but if we are in town around dinner, we try to stop by.  Parking can be difficult if it is a busy weekend.  The food is good and service is generally pretty good.  The menu is varied, but standard Mexican fare.  With the movies across the street and their quick service, it is a nice place to drop in and get some food before a show.  The ambiance is nice, but the bathrooms are a bit rough sometimes.  Pricing for the menu items is good, especially compared to other restaurants in the area.

data.title: Great food and full bar
data.text: Came for lunch. They also have breakfast. Also a good place for a date, as the movie theatre is across the street. If you need anything just ask the staff.

data.title: Mexican food for all
data.text:
Good parking, good service, good salsa, good food and drinks.
Just what you want when you want south of the border tacos.
I like the chicken nachos and jalapenos, muey buano!
